     - Added state: `const [userSettings, setUserSettings] = useState<UserSettings | null>(null);`
     - Added useEffect for fetching avatar data:
       ```typescript
       useEffect(() => {
         const fetchUserSettings = async () => {
           if (!user?.id) {
             setUserSettings(null);
             return;
           }
           try {
             const { data, error } = await supabase
               .from('users')
               .select('avatar_url')
               .eq('auth_id', user.id)
               .single();
             if (error) {
               console.error('Error fetching user avatar:', error);
               setUserSettings(null);
               return;
             }
             setUserSettings(data);
           } catch (err) {
             console.error('Error:', err);
             setUserSettings(null);
           }
         };
         fetchUserSettings();
       }, [user, supabase]);
       ```
     - Replaced letter placeholder (lines 292-296) with:
       ```typescript
       <div className="mr-3">
         <AvatarDisplay 
           avatarUrl={userSettings?.avatar_url}
           email={user?.email}
           size="sm"
         />
       </div>
       ```

```
    69â†’    function handleClickOutside(event: MouseEvent) {
    70â†’      const target = event.target as HTMLElement;
    71â†’      
    72â†’      // Don't close dropdown if clicking on a link or inside a link
    73â†’      const isLinkClick = target.tagName === 'A' || target.closest('a');
    74â†’      if (isLinkClick) {
    75â†’        return;
    76â†’      }
    77â†’      
    78â†’      // Close user dropdown
    79â†’      if (
    80â†’        userDropdownRef.current &&
    81â†’        !userDropdownRef.current.contains(target)
    82â†’      ) {
    83â†’        setIsUserDropdownOpen(false);
    84â†’      }
    85â†’      
    86â†’      // Close nav dropdowns
    87â†’      Object.keys(navDropdowns).forEach(key => {
    88â†’        if (
    89â†’          navDropdownRefs.current[key] &&
    90â†’          !navDropdownRefs.current[key]?.contains(target)
    91â†’        ) {
    92â†’          setNavDropdowns(prev => ({ ...prev, [key]: false }));
    93â†’        }
    94â†’      });
    95â†’    }
    96â†’    document.addEventListener('mousedown', handleClickOutside);
    97â†’    return () => document.removeEventListener('mousedown', handleClickOutside);
    98â†’  }, [navDropdowns]);
    99â†’
```

```
    29â†’          .single();
    30â†’
    31â†’        if (userError || !userData) {
    32â†’          setError('User not found');
    33â†’          setLoading(false);
    34â†’          return;
    35â†’        }
    36â†’
    37â†’        setUserInternalId(userData.id);
    38â†’
    39â†’        // Fetch user's host account data via API (bypasses RLS)
    40â†’        console.log('Fetching host account data for user ID (V2):', userData.id);
    41â†’        
    42â†’        const response = await fetch(`/api/get_hostaccount_data_v2?user_internal_id=${userData.id}`);
    43â†’        const result = await response.json();
    44â†’
    45â†’        console.log('API fetch result (V2):', result);
    46â†’
    47â†’        if (result.success) {
    48â†’          console.log('Setting host account data (V2):', result.data);
    49â†’          setHostAccountsData(result.data || []);
    50â†’        } else {
    51â†’          console.error('Error fetching host account (V2):', result.error);
    52â†’          setError('Error fetching host account data');
    53â†’        }
    54â†’      } catch (err) {
    55â†’        console.error('Error (V2):', err);
    56â†’        setError('An error occurred');
    57â†’      } finally {
    58â†’        setLoading(false);
    59â†’      }
    60â†’    };
    61â†’
    62â†’    fetchHostAccountsData();
    63â†’  }, [user?.id, supabase]);
    64â†’
    65â†’  // Function to refetch data after any modifications
    66â†’  const refetchHostAccountsData = async () => {
    67â†’    console.log('Refetching data (V2)...', { userId: user?.id, userInternalId });
    68â†’    
    69â†’    if (!user?.id || !userInternalId) {
    70â†’      console.log('Missing user data for refetch (V2)');
    71â†’      return;
    72â†’    }
    73â†’
    74â†’    try {
    75â†’      const response = await fetch(`/api/get_hostaccount_data_v2?user_internal_id=${userInternalId}`);
    76â†’      const result = await response.json();
    77â†’
    78â†’      console.log('Refetch API result (V2):', result);
    79â†’
    80â†’      if (result.success) {
    81â†’        console.log('Setting new data (V2):', result.data);
    82â†’        setHostAccountsData(result.data || []);
    83â†’      } else {
    84â†’        console.error('Error in refetch (V2):', result.error);
    85â†’      }
    86â†’    } catch (err) {
    87â†’      console.error('Error refetching data (V2):', err);
    88â†’    }
    89â†’  };
    90â†’
    91â†’  if (!user) {
    92â†’    return (
    93â†’      <div className="w-full p-4">
    94â†’        <div className="text-center">
    95â†’          <p>Please sign in to manage your host account.</p>
    96â†’        </div>
    97â†’      </div>
    98â†’    );
    99â†’  }
   100â†’
   101â†’  if (loading) {
   102â†’    return (
   103â†’      <div className="w-full p-4">
   104â†’        <div className="text-center">
   105â†’          <p>Loading host account data...</p>
   106â†’        </div>
   107â†’      </div>
   108â†’    );
   109â†’  }
   110â†’
   111â†’  if (error) {
   112â†’    return (
   113â†’      <div className="w-full p-4">
   114â†’        <div className="text-center text-red-600">
   115â†’          <p>Error: {error}</p>
   116â†’        </div>
   117â†’      </div>
   118â†’    );
   119â†’  }
   120â†’
   121â†’  return (
   122â†’    <div className="w-full p-4">

   125â†’        <p className="text-gray-600">
```

Result:

```
1â†’import { createClient } from '@supabase/supabase-js';
     2â†’import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server';
     3â†’
     4â†’export async function GET(request: NextRequest) {
     5â†’  try {
     6â†’    // Initialize Supabase client with service role key
     7â†’    const supabase = createClient(
     8â†’      process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL!,
     9â†’      process.env.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY!
    10â†’    );
    11â†’
    12â†’    // Get user_internal_id from query params
    13â†’    const { searchParams } = new URL(request.url);
    14â†’    const userInternalId = searchParams.get('user_internal_id');
    15â†’
    16â†’    if (!userInternalId) {
    17â†’      return NextResponse.json(
    18â†’        { success: false, error: 'User internal ID is required' },
    19â†’        { status: 400 }
    20â†’      );
    21â†’    }
    22â†’
    23â†’    console.log('Fetching host account with company join for user ID (V2):', userInternalId);
    24â†’
    25â†’    // Fetch all host account records with joined host_company data
    26â†’    const { data: hostAccounts, error } = await supabase
    27â†’      .from('host_account')
    28â†’      .select(`
    29â†’        *,
    30â†’        host_company:fk_host_company_id (
    31â†’          id,
    32â†’          name,
    33â†’          portal_url1,
    34â†’          fk_user_id,
    35â†’          notes1,
    36â†’          notes2,
    37â†’          notes3
    38â†’        )
    39â†’      `)
    40â†’      .eq('fk_user_id', userInternalId);
    41â†’
    42â†’    if (error) {
    43â†’      console.error('Error fetching host account with join (V2):', error);
    44â†’      return NextResponse.json(
    45â†’        { success: false, error: 'Failed to fetch host account data' },
    46â†’        { status: 500 }
    47â†’      );
    48â†’    }
    49â†’
    50â†’    console.log(`Found ${hostAccounts?.length || 0} host account records with company data for user (V2)`);
    51â†’
    52â†’    return NextResponse.json({
    53â†’      success: true,
    54â†’      data: hostAccounts || []
    55â†’    });
    56â†’
    57â†’  } catch (error) {
    58â†’    console.error('get_hostaccount_data_v2 API error:', error);
    59â†’    return NextResponse.json(
    60â†’      { success: false, error: 'Internal server error' },
    61â†’      { status: 500 }
    62â†’    );
    63â†’  }
    64â†’}
```

```
1â†’'use client';
     2â†’
     3â†’import { useState, useMemo } from 'react';
     4â†’
     5â†’interface HostCompany {
     6â†’  id: string;
     7â†’  name: string | null;
     8â†’  portal_url1: string | null;
     9â†’  fk_user_id: string;
    10â†’  notes1: string | null;
    11â†’  notes2: string | null;
    12â†’  notes3: string | null;
    13â†’}
    14â†’
    15â†’interface HostAccountRecord {
    16â†’  id: string; // UUID
    17â†’  username: string | null;
    18â†’  pass: string | null;
    19â†’  hostacct_apikey1: string | null;
    20â†’  fk_user_id: string;
    21â†’  fk_host_company_id: string | null;
    22â†’  host_company: HostCompany | null;
    23â†’}
    24â†’
    25â†’interface HostAccountsUITableV2Props {
    26â†’  data: HostAccountRecord[];
    27â†’  userId: string;
    28â†’  onDataChange?: () => void;
    29â†’}
    30â†’
    31â†’type SortField = keyof HostAccountRecord;
    32â†’type SortOrder = 'asc' | 'desc';
    33â†’
    34â†’export default function HostAccountsUITableV2({ data, onDataChange }: HostAccountsUITableV2Props) {
    35â†’  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = useState('');
    36â†’  const [currentPage, setCurrentPage] = useState(1);
    37â†’  const [itemsPerPage, setItemsPerPage] = useState(20);
    38â†’  const [sortField, setSortField] = useState<SortField>('id');
    39â†’  const [sortOrder, setSortOrder] = useState<SortOrder>('desc');
    40â†’  const [selectedHostAccounts, setSelectedHostAccounts] = useState<Set<string>>(new Set());
    41â†’  const [selectAll, setSelectAll] = useState(false);
    42â†’
    43â†’  // Filter and search logic
    44â†’  const filteredData = useMemo(() => {
    45â†’    return data.filter(item => {
    46â†’      // Search filter
    47â†’      const searchLower = searchTerm.toLowerCase();
    48â†’      const matchesSearch = !searchTerm || 
    49â†’        item.username?.toLowerCase().includes(searchLower) ||
    50â†’        item.id?.toLowerCase().includes(searchLower) ||
    51â†’        item.fk_host_company_id?.toLowerCase().includes(searchLower) ||
    52â†’        item.host_company?.name?.toLowerCase().includes(searchLower) ||
    53â†’        item.host_company?.portal_url1?.toLowerCase().includes(searchLower) ||
    54â†’        item.host_company?.notes1?.toLowerCase().includes(searchLower) ||
    55â†’        item.host_company?.notes2?.toLowerCase().includes(searchLower) ||
    56â†’        item.host_company?.notes3?.toLowerCase().includes(searchLower);
    57â†’
    58â†’      return matchesSearch;
    59â†’    });
    60â†’  }, [data, searchTerm]);
    61â†’
    62â†’  // Sort logic
    63â†’  const sortedData = useMemo(() => {
    64â†’    const sorted = [...filteredData].sort((a, b) => {
    65â†’      let aVal: any = a[sortField];
    66â†’      let bVal: any = b[sortField];
    67â†’
    68â†’      // Handle null values
    69â†’      if (aVal === null || aVal === undefined) aVal = '';
    70â†’      if (bVal === null || bVal === undefined) bVal = '';
    71â†’
    72â†’      // Handle object values (like host_company) by converting to string
    73â†’      if (typeof aVal === 'object') aVal = '';
    74â†’      if (typeof bVal === 'object') bVal = '';
    75â†’
    76â†’      // Convert to lowercase for string comparison
    77â†’      if (typeof aVal === 'string') {
    78â†’        aVal = aVal.toLowerCase();
    79â†’        bVal = (bVal as string).toLowerCase();
    80â†’      }
    81â†’
    82â†’      if (sortOrder === 'asc') {
    83â†’        return aVal > bVal ? 1 : -1;
    84â†’      } else {
    85â†’        return aVal < bVal ? 1 : -1;
    86â†’      }
    87â†’    });
    88â†’
    89â†’    return sorted;
    90â†’  }, [filteredData, sortField, sortOrder]);
    91â†’
    92â†’  // Pagination logic
    93â†’  const paginatedData = useMemo(() => {
    94â†’    const startIndex = (currentPage - 1) * itemsPerPage;
    95â†’    const endIndex = startIndex + itemsPerPage;
    96â†’    return sortedData.slice(startIndex, endIndex);
    97â†’  }, [sortedData, currentPage, itemsPerPage]);
    98â†’
    99â†’  const totalPages = Math.ceil(sortedData.length / itemsPerPage);
   100â†’
```

`SUPABASE_URL=https://jerylujyofmmjukwlwvn.supabase.co SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJzdXBhYmFzZSIsInJlZiI6ImplcnlsdWp5b2ZtbWp1a3dsd3ZuIiwicm9sZSI6InNlcnZpY2Vfcm9sZSIsImlhdCI6MTc1NDQyNTE1MCwiZXhwIjoyMDcwMDAxMTUwfQ.09zsgogOOCZeaJ9R6K5D4q2_jzKXFh54f-CNBfwrEQc node -e "
const { createClient } = require('@supabase/supabase-js');
const supabase = createClient(process.env.SUPABASE_URL, process.env.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY);

async function analyzeHaccjar2Schema() {
  try {
    console.log('ğŸ” ANALYZING HACCJAR2 DATABASE SCHEMA');
    console.log('===================================');
    
    // 1. Analyze host_account table
    console.log('\nğŸ“‹ HOST_ACCOUNT TABLE:');
    const { data: hostAccountData, error: hostError } = await supabase
      .from('host_account')
      .select('*')
      .limit(1);
    
    if (!hostError && hostAccountData && hostAccountData.length > 0) {
      console.log('Host Account fields:');
      Object.keys(hostAccountData[0]).forEach(field => {
        const value = hostAccountData[0][field];
        const type = value === null ? 'null' : typeof value;
        console.log('  - ' + field + ': ' + type);
      });
    } else {
      console.log('No host_account data or error:', hostError?.message);
    }
    
    // 2. Analyze host_company table
    console.log('\nğŸ“‹ HOST_COMPANY TABLE:');
    const { data: hostCompanyData, error: companyError } = await supabase
      .from('host_company')
      .select('*')
      .limit(1);
    
    if (!companyError && hostCompanyData && hostCompanyData.length > 0) {
      console.log('Host Company fields:');
      Object.keys(hostCompanyData[0]).forEach(field => {
        const value = hostCompanyData[0][field];
        const type = value === null ? 'null' : typeof value;
        console.log('  - ' + field + ': ' + type);
      });
    } else {
      console.log('No host_company data or error:', companyError?.message);
    }
    
    // 3. Get counts for both tables
    const { count: hostAccountCount } = await supabase
      .from('host_account')
      .select('*', { count: 'exact', head: true });
    
    const { count: hostCompanyCount } = await supabase
      .from('host_company')
      .select('*', { count: 'exact', head: true });
    
    console.log('\nğŸ“Š TABLE STATISTICS:');
    console.log('host_account records:', hostAccountCount);
    console.log('host_company records:', hostCompanyCount);
    
    // 4. Test the join query used by the API
    console.log('\nğŸ”— JOIN QUERY TEST:');
    const { data: joinData, error: joinError } = await supabase
      .from('host_account')
      .select(`
        *,
        host_company:fk_host_company_id (
          id,
          name,
          portal_url1,
          fk_user_id,
          notes1,
          notes2,
          notes3
        )
      `)
      .limit(3);
    
    if (!joinError && joinData) {
      console.log('Join query successful, returned', joinData.length, 'records');
      if (joinData.length > 0) {
        console.log('Sample joined record structure:');
        const sample = joinData[0];
        Object.keys(sample).forEach(key => {
          if (key === 'host_company') {
            console.log('  - host_company: object with fields:', 
              sample.host_company ? Object.keys(sample.host_company).join(', ') : 'null');
          } else {
            console.log('  - ' + key + ':', typeof sample[key]);
          }
        });
      }
    } else {
      console.log('Join query error:', joinError?.message);
    }
    
    console.log('\nâœ… HACCJAR2 SCHEMA ANALYSIS COMPLETE');
    
  } catch (err) {
    console.error('ğŸ’¥ Error:', err.message);
  }
}

analyzeHaccjar2Schema();"`
